3: That is the information Alpha coerced out of the hiding mermaid by pressing her katana against her throat, the night before the final plan was to be executed.
At the same time, Luna learns the location of the experimental ultra-high energy antenna cluster.
Lamia, returning from the Arctic, shares the same fact Huaxu did.
The Project Winter... This name again.
Y-yes. Everything related to the plan has been transferred to the depths of the laboratory.
...Looks like it's exactly how you said it would be, Huaxu.
The Project Winter is the reason the antenna cluster is in the laboratory.
She transfers the name list she has just received to Huaxu.
So, with this new clue from Lamia, can you give me some information?
Checking related records>>>>>>>>Complete.
The relevant personnel record has been found. A search has returned the target's activity records.
Cut to the chase.
The information is consistent with the individual named Lamia. Kaplan remains active and is organizing the transfer of items to the underground laboratory.
Based on the contents of the seized message from the target, it is presumed that they are seeking information on other deceased individuals from an encrypted address in Babylonia.
These include your previously searched queries of Rand and Ann, as well as Ravenge and Hiro.
Lamia, don't tell anyone about this.
Are you going alone?
Yes, let them think I went to pick something up.
...Forgive me for saying this, but they will get suspicious.
In that case, let them stay there with their questions.
Why do you have to go alone?
I don't want to create new problems. You still have a lot of plans for that area, don't you?
Besides, there's no need for my sister to know about what comes after the plan.
She lowers her head, ruminating the consequences keeping it from Alpha will bring.
Given her way of doing things, she won't let me go to the Arctic alone either... will she?
In that case, let her intercept the Forest Guards.
After the battle at Kowloong, she definitely has questions for Rosetta.
You seem irritated.
If it's 'stupid things as always,' you wouldn't be making that expression. Does it have anything to do with what Huaxu showed you?
Sister.
Yes?
...The institute brought back some memories from my past.
Alpha remains silent for a moment. Obviously, she knows what Luna meant by her past.
That underground laboratory is used to imprison Amberia. It is an expression of their desire and arrogance, just like the military posts.

But unlike the military posts, this debt is owed by the Arctic Route Union. When Amberia fell into a deep slumber, the area should have gone to the Forest Guards. The Ascendants need not have intervened.
And that military post was destroyed through a combined effort when Alpha broke free...
With Lamia's intervention, the plan against the Ascendants was no longer feasible and the parties ceased their cooperation.
...At least, that was what was assumed to have happened then.
It's now in ruins.
I understand why you feel this way, but that wasn't the smartest course of action.
You don't need to worry about me, Sister.
No one can shake the power of Ascnet. Not as one person. Not as a group.
I wouldn't state the obvious.
Destroying that institute can't change the past. It will only affect your mood.
Do you want to do something for them?
I only did what I wanted to do.
Luna hovers next to her sister and gazes off at the ruins in the distance.
I'm not interested in seeking justice for those 'sinners.'
I'm only interested in uprooting the disgusting things that I hate.
No matter if my actions benefit others, they will never thank me. But, I've never sought humanity's gratitude.
I only do what I want to do. And that's all I'll ever do.
She smiles fleetingly.
Disgusting things...
Alpha only knows what exactly was going on when she gets the news from Lamia.
...I always seem to make inferences based on how you used to think as a child. That's me being arrogant.
Alpha opens her eyes, deciding to do a sweep of the greenhouse just to be sure before leaving.
Since the emergence of the noise, she is often pulled into her memories.
The voices seem to be trying to evoke a certain emotion by blazing through her M.I.N.D.
Just as she is about to head to the greenhouse, she sees Cinderelik walking over, hugging the remnants of a familiar mechanoid.
...That's Gabriel's...
A question popped into Alpha's mind.
That girl has the ability to create Hetero-Creatures... Can she use that to revive Gabriel?
No, that's impossible.
Even if she forges a new body for him, there is no way Gabriel would return as good as new.
So why is Cinderelik recycling his head?
Multiple possibilities flash through Alpha's head, but none was plausible.
In order the quell the unease she is feeling, Alpha follows Cinderelik.
Stop her!
Just as Cinderelik starts singing, Alpha hears a familiar voice on the other side of the door.
It's that commandant. The Gray Ravens are here too?
The Gray Ravens aren't currently the main target, so Alpha sees no need to clash with them. Instead, she flattens herself against the wall and hides a distance away in the shadows.
Well, now you have the chance to ask and find out if the commandant knows what happened to Luna.
While pondering the noise's suggestion, the surrounding area starts to shake violently and rocks are even falling from the ceiling.
An earthquake?
No, it looks like the shaking is coming from the greenhouse. Could it be Cinderelik?
She gazes in the direction of the greenhouse, remembering the behemoth 'sleeping' above.
Upon sensing its presence, Alpha's M.I.N.D. receives an encrypted message from Ascnet.
It is like a whisper in her ear, speaking a language that only she understands and making clear the future it will bring.
If it killed the Gray Ravens, things would go back to what they were before.
She wants to stop them, but she senses they might be stronger than she gives them credit for. While watching, she notices a dark figure emerging.
...Vonnegut.
He seems to notice something. Before stepping into the greenhouse, he looks back at where Alpha is hiding.
A brief moment of silence passes and Alpha steps out of the shadows and heads toward the greenhouse.
You wish to help them?
I need those who know the truth to survive.
Which truth?
Whether it's about Vonnegut or her frame, it'll all be in my favor.
The former will result in the humans' spear being pointed somewhere else, while the latter will rattle the Gray Ravens.
What do you expect them to do?
I need a seed that can break this deadlock.
There needs to be uncertainty in the world for it to be interesting, isn't that so?
Alpha follows the footsteps of the group, and comes upon a wide platform outside. Vonnegut's unique oppressive voice booms from the platform.
Welcome! Everyone is probably worried about what my next step will be, right?
To be honest, my purpose has been clear all along and that's to advance the filtering.
As such, I always welcome new blood.
But even if I issue you an invitation now, there will only be one answer.
I'd love to tell you all about our aspirations and ideals so that you can understand the importance of Ascnet and the filtering...
But when you are in a group, it's easy to buy into the illusion that you have a fighting chance.
No matter what I say at this moment, you won't listen, so...
Vonnegut raises his index finger and thumb like a gun and takes aim at the group.
Bang—!
As he makes that sound, rays of light almost invisible to the naked eye fire from behind the group.
His control over Ascnet's power is very precise.
Witnessing such an unexpected attack, Alpha refrains from getting involved for now and observes Vonnegut's battle style.
Commandant!
Lucia senses a ray behind her but does not try to dodge it. Instead, she rushes toward you while blocking the attacks aimed at the others with her katana.
...She's still so naive, but her senses have sharpened.
You may have remained unscathed under Lucia's protection, but she is not fast enough to block the final strike.
Lucia!
She staggers back, clutching her wound. Red vital fluid leaks from her right shoulder. The wound is deep, although the internal structure is undamaged.
She raises her head and looks around. Besides herself, everyone else has more or less taken some damage from this unexpected attack.
Wanshi! I'll leave it to you!
The Construct you call Wanshi hurries over to Lucia's side.
It's okay, I can still fight.
...Do you want to turn off the pain module?
There's no need to risk M.I.N.D. deviation with only this level of pain.
You can try all you want, but I still have lots of tricks up my sleeve. I can keep this up until you decide to obey me.
Are you going back on your agreement with Chrome?!
No, but I only agreed not to kill you. I didn't promise anything else.
Didn't the commandant over there let two flies go as well?
You mean Reyna and Percy?
Vonnegut gives a noncommittal smile.
It doesn't matter. I have no use for the weak. I won't even waste my time on them.
But as for you...
Although she can continue watching on the sidelines, given 'her' style of doing things, 'she' will be handing over tactical deployment to you.
An ignorant human, no less...
Alpha strides over to the group.
